label: Automated Itinerary Generation
description: AI-powered trip planning that auto-generates optimized day-by-day itineraries with personalized recommendations reducing planning time from hours to minutes with 90%+ traveler satisfaction.

traditional.workflow: 1. Traveler spends 3-8 hours researching destination: reading blogs, TripAdvisor, guidebooks. 2. Traveler manually creates day-by-day plan in Google Docs or spreadsheet. 3. Traveler must calculate travel times, opening hours, optimal routing between activities. 4. No personalization - everyone follows same 'top 10 things to do' lists. 5. Itinerary becomes outdated (venue closures, seasonal changes).
constraints: 3-8 hours manual research per trip
Generic recommendations not personalized to interests
No optimization for routing, timing, or travel distances
Static plans don't adapt to weather, closures, or delays
Spreadsheet/document format not mobile-friendly
No integration with bookings or reservations

agentic.workflow: 1. Itinerary Generation Agent receives traveler input: destination, dates, interests (food, culture, outdoors), pace preference (relaxed vs packed). 2. Personalization Engine analyzes traveler profile: past trips, review patterns, spending habits, dietary preferences. 3. Agent generates day-by-day itinerary: activities, restaurants, optimal routes, estimated times, costs. 4. Optimization Algorithm balances: geographic clustering, opening hours, travel times, budget constraints. 5. Agent integrates bookings: reservations, tickets, confirmed activities linked to itinerary.
dataSources: Traveler profile with interests and preferences
Past traveler itineraries and satisfaction scores
benefits: 90% time reduction (15-30 min vs 3-8 hours)
Personalized to individual interests vs generic top-10 lists
Optimized routing saves 2-4 hours of travel time per day
Mobile-friendly format with maps and directions
Integrated with bookings and reservations
90%+ traveler satisfaction vs 60-70% for self-planned trips

label: Multi-Traveler Coordination
description: Collaborative trip planning with shared itineraries and voting enabling seamless coordination for group travel reducing planning friction by 60-80%.

traditional.workflow: 1. Trip organizer sends group text or email thread with proposed plans. 2. Group members respond asynchronously with preferences, creating 50+ message thread chaos. 3. Organizer manually reconciles conflicting preferences and schedules. 4. Final itinerary sent via email - some members miss updates. 5. Day-of changes communicated via text, creating confusion about current plan.
constraints: Email/text threads with 50-100+ messages are chaotic
No centralized view of group preferences or votes
Organizer burden to reconcile all input manually
Updates lost in thread - travelers have different versions
No real-time coordination during trip
Conflicting preferences resolved by organizer fiat (frustration)

agentic.workflow: 1. Trip Coordination Agent creates shared trip workspace for all travelers. 2. Voting Engine allows members to vote on options: restaurants, activities, timing (majority rules or consensus mode). 3. Preference Aggregation Agent collects input: dietary needs, mobility constraints, budget preferences, must-see attractions. 4. Agent generates itinerary balancing group preferences, flags conflicts for discussion. 5. Real-Time Sync keeps all travelers updated: push notifications for changes, map view of group location during trip.
dataSources: Group voting results and consensus levels
benefits: 60-80% reduction in coordination effort
Single source of truth vs fragmented email threads
Democratic voting eliminates organizer burden
Real-time sync prevents version conflicts
Push notifications keep everyone informed
Accessibility and dietary needs auto-flagged

quickWins: Launch shared itinerary with voting for group bookings
Add real-time push notifications for itinerary changes

label: Real-Time Disruption Management
description: Proactive monitoring and automatic rebooking for flight delays and cancellations reducing traveler stress and downtime by 70-85% through instant alternative arrangements.

traditional.workflow: 1. Flight delayed or cancelled - customer learns via airport monitor or gate agent. 2. Customer stands in 60-90 minute rebooking line at airport. 3. Agent manually searches for alternatives on overloaded system during irregular ops. 4. Customer may miss connections, hotel reservations, important meetings. 5. Customer must separately rebook hotel, car rental, missed activities.
constraints: Customer learns of disruption only at airport (no proactive alerts)
60-90 min rebooking wait during irregular operations
Downstream impacts (hotel, car, activities) not addressed
Limited rebooking options due to high demand during disruptions
No compensation or recovery offers proactively presented
Customer frustration and loyalty erosion from poor experience

agentic.workflow: 1. Disruption Monitoring Agent tracks real-time flight status, weather, airline operations data. 2. Alert Agent detects delay/cancellation and immediately notifies customer via push, SMS, email (30-60 min before airline announcement). 3. Automatic Rebooking Agent finds best alternative flights, presents options in app with one-tap acceptance. 4. Downstream Coordination Agent auto-adjusts hotel, car rental, activity bookings to new schedule. 5. Compensation Agent proactively offers meal vouchers, lounge access, hotel for overnight delays per policy.
dataSources: Real-time flight status and delay predictions
Airline compensation and service recovery policies
benefits: 70-85% stress reduction through proactive management
30-60 min advance notice vs at-airport surprise
5-10 min rebooking vs 60-90 min agent lines
Automatic coordination of hotel, car, activities
Proactive compensation improves satisfaction 40-60%
Customer loyalty retention during disruptions

hitlGate.threshold: Rebooking cost >$500 or schedule change >4 hours
hitlGate.policy: Present options for customer approval before auto-rebooking high-impact changes

quickWins: Implement proactive delay alerts 30 min before airline

label: Alternative Options & Rebooking
description: Intelligent multi-carrier and multi-modal alternative search during disruptions with instant rebooking reducing stranded time by 50-70% through comprehensive options.

traditional.workflow: 1. Flight cancelled - agent only searches same airline for alternatives. 2. Same-airline options may be 12-24 hours away due to limited inventory. 3. Customer not offered alternatives on partner airlines or other carriers. 4. Ground transportation alternatives (train, bus) not considered. 5. Customer left to manually research and book alternatives at own expense.
constraints: Single-carrier search limits alternative options
12-24 hour delays common when airline is fully booked
No partner airline or alliance rebooking proactively offered
Ground transportation ignored (even if faster/better)
Customer may pay out-of-pocket for better alternative
Loyalty erosion when better options exist but not offered

agentic.workflow: 1. Alternative Search Agent simultaneously searches: same airline, partner airlines, alliance carriers, competing airlines with interline agreements. 2. Multi-Modal Agent evaluates ground options: high-speed rail, bus, car rental for sub-400 mile trips. 3. Optimization Engine ranks options by: arrival time, cost, travel comfort, customer preference (fastest vs cheapest). 4. Agent presents top 3-5 alternatives with clear comparison and one-tap booking. 5. Interline Booking Agent handles cross-carrier rebooking, luggage transfer, ticket reissue.
dataSources: Customer preferences (fastest vs cheapest vs comfort)
benefits: 50-70% reduction in stranded time (4-8 hours vs 12-24 hours)
5-10 carrier options vs single airline
Multi-modal alternatives (flight, rail, car) for flexibility
Optimized by customer priority (time vs cost)
Seamless interline booking and luggage handling
Higher satisfaction through comprehensive options

quickWins: Enable partner airline search for disruptions
Add rail alternatives for <400 mile trips

label: Itinerary Sharing & Collaboration
description: Social sharing and family coordination features with real-time updates enabling seamless communication and 80-90% reduction in coordination overhead.

traditional.workflow: 1. Traveler forwards confirmation emails to family members for emergency contact. 2. Family member must parse 5-10 separate emails to understand traveler's schedule. 3. No real-time location or status updates during travel. 4. Traveler must manually text family at each leg ('landed in Chicago'). 5. Shared itinerary via Google Doc or PDF quickly becomes outdated.
constraints: Fragmented information across multiple emails
No real-time status or location sharing
Manual updates via text create burden on traveler
Family members can't see delays or disruptions
Emergency contacts don't have current itinerary
No proactive alerts to family for delays/cancellations

agentic.workflow: 1. Sharing Agent allows traveler to share itinerary link with family, colleagues, or social networks. 2. Real-Time Status Feed shows family members: current flight status, gate changes, delays, traveler location (if enabled). 3. Auto-Update Agent pushes notifications to shared contacts for major changes (cancellations, significant delays). 4. Location Sharing (opt-in) provides peace of mind for family during travel. 5. Emergency Contact Integration gives emergency contacts instant access to full itinerary and current location.
dataSources: Real-time flight status and gate information
benefits: 80-90% reduction in manual coordination (no manual texts needed)
Real-time visibility eliminates family anxiety
Proactive alerts keep family informed of disruptions
One-tap sharing vs forwarding multiple emails
Emergency contacts have instant access to current itinerary
Privacy controls allow granular sharing (location vs itinerary only)

quickWins: Enable one-tap itinerary sharing with real-time status
Add automatic delay alerts to shared contacts

label: Travel Document Management
description: Automated passport and visa requirement verification with expiration tracking reducing denied boarding and entry issues by 90-95% through proactive compliance.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer books international flight without checking passport expiration. 2. Customer discovers at airport that passport expires within 6 months (denied boarding in many countries). 3. Customer responsible for researching visa requirements manually. 4. Customer may arrive at destination and be denied entry due to missing visa. 5. Airline/hotel have no liability but suffer reputation damage.
constraints: 5-10% of international bookings have document issues
Denied boarding costs airline $200-500 per incident
No proactive document verification at booking
Customer unaware of 6-month passport validity rules
Visa requirements complex and frequently changing
Customer frustration and loyalty erosion from preventable issues

agentic.workflow: 1. Document Verification Agent checks passport expiration at booking (must be 6+ months valid for most destinations). 2. Visa Requirement Engine validates visa needs based on: destination country, traveler nationality, trip purpose, stay duration. 3. Alert Agent notifies traveler at booking if passport renewal needed or visa required. 4. Document Wallet stores encrypted passport, visa, vaccination records accessible in mobile app. 5. Expiration Monitoring Agent sends alerts 90, 60, 30 days before passport expiration.
dataSources: Customer passport information and expiration date
Visa requirement database by country pair
benefits: 90-95% reduction in document-related boarding denials
Proactive alerts at booking prevent issues vs at-airport surprises
$200-500 saved per prevented denied boarding incident
Automated visa requirement checking vs manual research
Digital document wallet for instant access
Improved customer satisfaction and loyalty

quickWins: Add passport expiration check at booking
Integrate IATA Timatic for visa requirements

label: Mobile Itinerary & Check-In
description: All-in-one mobile hub with offline access and automatic check-in delivering 95%+ mobile adoption and seamless travel experience from booking to boarding.

traditional.workflow: 1. Customer receives email confirmations, must print or save PDFs for each flight, hotel, car rental. 2. Customer must remember to check in online 24 hours before each flight. 3. Customer searches email at airport for confirmation codes. 4. No offline access - customer stranded without WiFi/cellular. 5. Boarding passes across multiple apps or paper printouts.
constraints: Fragmented experience across airline apps, emails, PDFs
Customer must manually check in for each flight
Email search at airport creates stress and delays
No offline functionality (helpless without connectivity)
Multiple apps and paper documents cumbersome
Missed check-in means poor seat selection

agentic.workflow: 1. Mobile Itinerary Agent consolidates all travel components in single app: flights, hotels, cars, activities. 2. Automatic Check-In Agent checks traveler in for flights 24 hours before departure, selects best available seat per preferences. 3. Offline Mode caches full itinerary, boarding passes, confirmations for no-connectivity scenarios. 4. Wallet Integration adds boarding passes to Apple Wallet/Google Pay for tap-to-board. 5. Contextual Assistant provides gate directions, airport maps, lounge access, real-time status.
benefits: 95%+ mobile adoption vs 40-60% traditional
Automatic check-in ensures best seat selection
Single app vs 5-10 emails and apps
100% offline access eliminates connectivity stress
Tap-to-board with mobile wallet
Contextual assistance reduces airport navigation time 40-60%

quickWins: Launch mobile app with consolidated itinerary view
Implement automatic check-in for top airline partners
